title: Ticket #3482: Python bindings are not resilient against version changes
description:
When we changed the version of master to 7.9.5, the build broke in the python bindings: 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tests/classad_tests.py", line 4, in <module>
    import classad
ImportError: /slots/04/dir_30792/userdir/src/condor_contrib/python-bindings/libpyclassad_7_9_5.so: undefined symbol: _ZNK7classad8ExprTree4selfEv

    Start 4: python_htcondor_test
4/5 Test #4: python_htcondor_test .............***Failed    0.05 sec
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tests/htcondor_tests.py", line 9, in <module>
    import classad
ImportError: /slots/04/dir_30792/userdir/src/condor_contrib/python-bindings/libpyclassad_7_9_5.so: undefined symbol: _ZNK7classad8ExprTree4selfEv

I think the following code is the culprit: 

PATH=$PWD/../../condor_collector.V6:$PWD/../../condor_schedd.V6:$PWD/../../condor_master.V6:$PWD/../../condor_tools:$PATH LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$PWD:$PWD/../../condor_utils:$PWD/../../classad:$PWD/../../../bld_external/classads-7.9.4/install/lib:$PWD/../../../release_dir/lib/condor PYTHONPATH=$PWD python "$@"

Note that 7.9.4 is hard-coded into the build.
remarks:
2013-Feb-05 10:28:04 by nwp:
Should have said this line is found in src/condor_contrib/python-bindings/test_driver

2013-Feb-05 12:40:59 by nwp:
Fixed this in the cmake file. Checked my fix in NMI. Pushed to master.
check_ins:
2013-Feb-05 12:40   Check-in [34857]: Fix python bindings through cmake #3482 Have cmake prepare the test_driver file from a template. Restore src/condor_contrib/python-bindings/tests/test.old.ad to previous version, as that "7.9.4" addition does not matter. (By Nathan W. Panike )
2013-Feb-05 09:58   Check-in [34855]: Placeholder commit to fix python bindings #3482 Brian should come up with something soon so this is not so fragile against version changes. (By Nathan W. Panike )
creator: nwp
